ai.summary: Corranbuie Trail is a 7.3 km moderate hike in the UK offering varied terrain and potential scenic viewpoints along a mostly rural route.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail combines forest paths with open surfaces. Expect portions of gentle climbs, uneven footing, and some rocky or root-strewn sections. Ground can be muddy after rain, so sturdy boots are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go; UK conditions can change quickly. Bring a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Wear sturdy walking boots, dress in layers with a waterproof outer shell, and carry enough water and snacks. Stay on marked paths, tell someone your route and expected return time, and be cautious on exposed sections and slippery rocks; wildlife and livestock may be present in rural sections. Mobile reception may be limited in remote stretches.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of delays)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) when daylight is longer and conditions are generally milder. Be prepared for rain year-round.
